intro: Pycnophyllum weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's pycnophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Pycnophyllum weberbaueri is adapted to high-altitude environments and plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
